Package quicktag.html

Class Write

java.lang.Object
quicktag.html.Write
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controller
public class Write
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller
Write has methods that allow you to finalize your content, and write your html/css to their respective pages.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface quicktag.data.Controller

    data

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Write()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void css​(java.lang.String cssFileName)
    Will generate a css file only, based on the name that you give it.
    void files​(java.lang.String htmlFileName, java.lang.String cssFileName, java.lang.String stylesheetURL)
    When this method is called, all the previous content that you have made above this method call will be written to generated html and css pages with the names you supplied.
    void html​(java.lang.String htmlFileName)
    Will generate a html file only, based on the name that you give it.
    void quick()
    When this method is called, all the previous content that you have made above this method call will be written to an automatically generated html-file "index.html", and a css-file "styles.css" respectively.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Write

      public Write()

  • Method Details

    • quick

      public void quick() throws java.io.IOException
      When this method is called, all the previous content that you have made above this method call will be written to an automatically generated html-file "index.html", and a css-file "styles.css" respectively. This is the quick write method, so you will not be able to name your html and css files. See the documentation for further details on how the write methods work.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Will happen if the files cannot be made and/or written to

    • files

      public void files​(java.lang.String htmlFileName, java.lang.String cssFileName, java.lang.String stylesheetURL) throws java.io.IOException
      When this method is called, all the previous content that you have made above this method call will be written to generated html and css pages with the names you supplied. You can also select which stylesheet you want this generated html file to actually use.
      Parameters:
      htmlFileName - The name of your html file
      cssFileName - The name of your css file
      stylesheetURL - The name of the stylesheet you want this page to use (can be the same as cssFileName)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Will happen if the files cannot be made and/or written to

    • html

      public void html​(java.lang.String htmlFileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Will generate a html file only, based on the name that you give it.
      Parameters:
      htmlFileName - The name of your html file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Will happen if the files cannot be made and/or written to

    • css

      public void css​(java.lang.String cssFileName) throws java.io.IOException
      Will generate a css file only, based on the name that you give it.
      Parameters:
      cssFileName - The name of your css file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Will happen if the files cannot be made and/or written to
